newsitem.title: UK: Eidos strikes James Bond, Chitty games deal.
newsitem.headline: Eidos strikes James Bond, Chitty games deal.

text.p: British entertainment software publisher and developer Eidos Plc said on Monday that it would start distributing in Europe the first of the software games covered by a recent license agreement with Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Inc unit MGM Interactive from this March.
The first two games will be "The Ultimate James Bond - An Interactive Experience" and "Chitty Chitty Bang Bang - Adventures in Tinkertown", both featuring well-known characters with British origins.
Eidos chief executive Charles Cornwall described the deal as putting the firm in touch with a company "with substantial content and with characters that already have high recognition".
MGM's European sales director Jim Banting said, "I believe we can drive multimedia into the mainstream by pooling resources with Eidos".
